posts.title: Critical Supply Chain Attack Targets Major Software Package Repositories
posts.excerpt: A sophisticated supply chain attack targeting npm, PyPI, and RubyGems repositories has been discovered, affecting thousands of organizations. Attackers are using dependency confusion and typosquatting techniques to inject malicious packages into development pipelines.
posts.author: Alex Chen, Senior Threat Intelligence Analyst

posts.title: Container Security Gaps in Cloud-Native Deployments
posts.excerpt: Analysis of recent container security incidents reveals critical gaps in cloud-native deployments. Multiple vulnerabilities in container orchestration layers could enable privilege escalation and data exfiltration.
posts.author: Dr. Sarah Johnson, Principal Security Researcher

posts.title: IAM Misconfigurations in Azure Cause Breaches
posts.excerpt: Recent security incidents highlight critical IAM misconfigurations in Azure deployments leading to data exposure. Analysis includes detection rules and remediation strategies.
posts.author: Marcus Rodriguez, Cloud Security Architect

posts.title: Zero-Day in Major Cloud Provider's Container Service: Critical Kubernetes Vulnerability Analysis
posts.excerpt: A critical vulnerability in Kubernetes orchestration layer allows privilege escalation and container escape. Immediate patching required for all cloud deployments.
posts.author: Alex Chen, Senior Threat Intelligence Analyst
